result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kristen Marie Besaw appeared by phone in custody.  Attorney Melissa Louise Barrette appeared by phone for Kristen Marie Besaw. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Court rcvd' and rvd' Defense bail motion. Atty Barrette, Client is still interested in going through treatment, Deft able to post 5000.00, requests cash bail be modified from $10,000 to $5,000. State objects to bond modification. Court grants Defense's request to modify cash bail from 10,000 to $5000.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
defense

3:32 PM Defendant Kristen Marie Besaw appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Barrette appeared by phone for the defendant. Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Barrette filed stipulation for substitution and this bail/bond and will be appearing for Deft going forward.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Atty Barrette - requesting $400.00 cash bond or lower cash. Has spoken w/Pathways for intensive outpatient treatment and confirmed that Deft would be able to start next week. Deft willing to comply with SCRAM bracelet for Day Reporting for 24/7 monitoring. Deft would live at address that was updated on July 18th in Plymouth.
State objects to any modification of bond and makes argument that $10,000.00 is necessary.
Court does not amend cash bond and denies Defense motion.
Substitution of Atty. Forella
Bail/bond hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
